course.title: Liberty
course.meeting_text: Tu., Th., at 1, and a weekly section to be arranged.
course.faculty_text: James Hankins (History) and Jeffrey A. Miron (Economics)
course.description: What is liberty? What considerations justify taking away an individual's freedom? All modern political philosophies and all forms of government claim to be liberating individuals or groups from oppression, but can these claims withstand critical scrutiny? Is power in the hands of the state the best way to secure the freedom and happiness of individuals? Beginning with an intellectual history of ideas of freedom in the Western tradition, the course proceeds to examine a series of issues and debates that invoke the value of freedom in the modern world: taxation, private property, public speech, and government attempts to shape and regulate the individual's behavior and morality.
